metadata.update_notes: Added 2025 company developments from web research

companies.name: Mixmax

overview.description: AI-native Sales Execution Platform with Inbox, Meeting, and Engagement Copilots. Integrates directly into Gmail and Outlook.

key_events: AI rebrand/pivot to 'AI-native Sales Execution Platform'
2025: Introduced three AI Meeting Copilots for sales execution
tenure_context.market_conditions: Competitive sales engagement market dominated by Outreach, Salesloft. AI differentiation becoming critical. No new funding since 2018 Series B - operating lean.

2025_update.product_evolution: Now positioned as AI Sales Execution Platform with three AI Meeting Copilots
2025_update.no_new_funding: 7+ years since last raise - capital efficient operation

companies.significance: Hired to build outbound GTM infrastructure during AI pivot phase. Responsible for domain warming, prospect database building, and playbook creation.

companies.name: Mobb

overview.description: AI-powered automatic vulnerability fixing tool. Uses Hybrid-AI technology to detect and remediate security vulnerabilities in code, generating ready-to-merge pull requests.

key_events: Product integration with Snyk, Checkmarx, GitHub Advanced Security
tenure_context.market_conditions: AppSec market growing rapidly with AI code generation creating new vulnerability risks. Shift-left security gaining traction.

companies.significance: Early GTM hire at seed-stage security startup. Short tenure (3 months) focused on market research and go-to-market strategy development.

companies.name: TraceAir Technologies

overview.description: Drone-powered site intelligence platform providing 3D scans, aerial imagery, and data analysis for construction and homebuilding. Covers land acquisition, development, vertical construction, and portfolio oversight.

key_events: 17 of top 20 US builders using platform
tenure_context.market_conditions: Construction tech adoption accelerating. Drone data becoming standard for large builders. Housing market volatile but builder tech investment steady.

2025_update.leadership_change: Sept 2025: Ivan Lvov appointed CEO (joined 2016 as CSO). Co-founder Maria Khokhlova moved to advisory role.
2025_update.growth_metrics: Nearly 300 active customers across North America. Global team of 170+ spanning US, Armenia, Spain.
2025_update.product_innovation: Layout Generator, TraceWalk interior documentation, advanced analytics, executive dashboards

companies.significance: SDR role during post-Series B growth phase. Prospected across 13 states, yielded $216,437.50 closed-won revenue. 22 demos in September (147% quota). Collaborated with senior AEs on stagnant accounts.

companies.name: Biofourmis

overview.description: Technology-enabled care delivery platform. Products include Hospital at Home, Timely Discharge, SNF at Home, and Remote Patient Monitoring. Partners with 50+ global health systems and payers across 25 US states.

tenure_context.company_stage: Post-Series C, pre-unicorn â†’ achieved unicorn during tenure
key_events: Series D closed April 2022 - unicorn status at $1.3B
Rapid commercial expansion in US market
Omar Ishrak (former Medtronic CEO) joined board as Chairman
tenure_context.market_conditions: COVID drove massive digital health adoption. RPM reimbursement expanding. Hospital systems seeking readmission reduction tools. Digital health funding peaked then contracted in 2022.

major_changes: Oct 2024: Merged with CoPilotIQ to create end-to-end AI-driven in-home care platform
2024: Founder Kuldeep Singh Rajput stepped down as CEO after layoffs (120 employees)
Jan 2025: ActiGraph acquired Biofourmis Connect (life sciences division)
Jan 2025: AdventHealth partnership on RPM program
2025: Lee Health launching Hospital at Home program
2024_2025_update.founder_update: Kuldeep Singh Rajput launched new health tech company OutcomesAI focused on generative AI
2024_2025_update.current_status: Active unicorn, but significant restructuring post-2022 peak

companies.significance: 2nd SDR hired for Commercial Care vertical at company that achieved unicorn status during tenure. Ground floor opportunity in hypergrowth digital health. Orlando Health deal (90-day close, fastest in company history) was proof of US hospital market viability.

companies.name: Bariatric Centers of America

founders: Dr. Mike Blaney (Army veteran, West Point graduate, board-certified bariatric surgeon)
overview.description: Program management platform digitizing the bariatric care journey. Products include BariTotalCare Package, BariLead, BariNav, and BariSuccess.

products.BariNav: Bariatric patient navigation and pipeline management system. HIPAA compliant messaging across phone, email, social, SMS. Custom workflows and automated patient follow-up.

funding.last_round: Unknown - appears bootstrapped or privately funded

key_events: BariNAV product development and market validation
tenure_context.market_conditions: Bariatric surgery market growing with obesity epidemic. Patient navigation becoming critical for surgical programs to improve conversion rates.

companies.significance: Collaborated on enterprise sales and BariNAV product development. Helped bring technology solutions to bariatric surgery programs.
